title: Alison Wonderland Welcomes Second Son: ‘Baby Bro Is Very Chill’
summary: The producer is also releasing her Ghost World album on Dec. 5.
body: Alison Wonderland has delivered her latest production: a baby boy. On Monday (Nov. 10), the electronic producer announced that she’s given birth to her second son, writing “Welcome to earth, Ash West. Baby bro is very chill & loves listening to anything electronic at 140bpm (almost a week old & kid already has taste). s/o to the drs, nurses and the NICU for being awesome.” The Australia-born, Los Angeles-based producer also shared several photos of herself and her new baby. See the post here . Wonderland and her husband, the filmmaker Ti West, also have another son, Max, who was born in the summer of 2023. The post’s comments section is naturally a celebratory space, with fellow electronic artists including Anna Lunoe, TroyBoi, Slander, DJ Dave, Diplo, Mary Droppinz and many more expressing their congrats. Baby Ash is the first of two very big projects Wonderland is dropping in this time period, as the producer’s fourth studio album, Ghost World , is coming Dec. 5. (While it was originally scheduled for an October release, production delay issues pushed the project to December.) “I am in a completely different part of my life now,” the artist …

title: Summer Walker Reveals Chris Brown, GloRilla, 21 Savage, Latto, Sexyy Red & More Features on ‘Finally Over It’ Album
summary: Pour Minds podcast hosts Drea Nicole and Lex P acted as caterers at Walker's wedding gossiping about the A-list guests on her third album, out Friday.
body: Summer Walker revealed the star-studded list of collaborators on her forthcoming third studio album Finally Over It on Monday (Nov. 10). She partnered with Spotify on the exclusive two-part announcement, that includes a behind-the-scenes clip from Walker’s “wedding” (as teased in her album artwork ) and a reception seating chart graphic of the featured artists, songwriters and producers who worked on Finally Over It , both of which can be found below. Drea Nicole and Lex P, the hosts of the Pour Minds podcast, act as caterers of Walker’s wedding while gossiping about her A-list guests. “Did you see 21 Savage with that plate of beans?… You know he British, chile,” Lex told Drea. Walker has previously collaborated with the British-born, Atlanta-bred rapper four times: a remix of Jhené Aiko’s “Triggered” in 2019, 2020’s “Secret,” Usher’s 2023 hit “Good Good,” and 2024’s “prove it” from 21 Savage’s third studio album American Dream . Drea wondered if Anderson .Paak would give them his wig vendor because “hair was laid,” she complimented. She also didn&#82…

title: Kelly Clarkson Recalls Fiery Response to Manager Who Told Her to Get a Boob Job: ‘Why Don’t You Get a Di– Job?’
summary: The star added that she's just fine with her "itty bitty ti--ies," thank you very much.
body: Kelly Clarkson is ready for the industry to break away from toxic beauty standards — or, at the very least, for people to stop thinking it’s acceptable to tell women what to do with their bodies. While onstage for one of her Studio Session shows at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas over the weekend, the hitmaker took a moment to make sure her deep V-neck top was covering up everything it needed to, which reminded her of an unpleasant interaction with someone in the music business. “I had some di– manager one time tell me to get a boob job,” she recalled, the shock of the experience returning to her face as if it had just happened in that moment. Related Kelly Clarkson Reveals Her Top Three Albums of All-Time: ‘I Hope You Like Them, If You Don’t, You’re Dumb’ Kelly Clarkson Is ‘Finding the Light’ in Talk Show Season Premiere: ‘The World Can Be Very Heavy’ Drew Barrymore Wins in an Upset Over Kelly Clarkson at 2025 Daytime Emmys “I was like, ‘Why don’t you get a di– job?'” Clarkson continued. “I’m fine with my itty bitty ti–ies, get out of here.&#822…

title: Billboard’s Music Industry Events Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. Related Dates Announced for SXSW London Debut Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' November 2025 Nov. 7-16 – New York Comedy Festival (New York) Nov. 9-11 – jump.global Annual Summit (Los Angeles) Nov. 10 – iHeartMedia Q3 earnings call Nov. 11 –   Proud to Honor: A Benefit Concert Celebrating America’s Heroes (Nashville) Nov. 11 – Save the Music’s Hometown to Hometown Event (Nashville) Nov. 11 – Sony fiscal Q2 earnings call Nov. 12 – Bloomberg Podcast Business Summit at On Air LA (Santa Monica, Ca…

title: Michael Jackson Makes History as First Artist to Score Hot 100 Top 10 Hits in Six Different Decades
summary: The late King of Pop’s “Thriller” gives him top 10 placements in every decade from the 1970s through the 2020s.
body: Michael Jackson ’s “Thriller” strikes like a beast, rising from No. 32 to No. 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 dated Nov. 15, granting the late King of Pop a new chart longevity record. With the song, which hit No. 4 on the Hot 100 in 1984, Jackson, who died in 2009, becomes the first artist ever to rank in the top 10 in six distinct decades (the 1970s, ‘80s, ‘90s, 2000s, ‘10s and now ‘20s). Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ Leads Hot 100 for Fifth Week, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’ Returns to Top 10 These Acts Have Scored Top 10 Hits on the Billboard Hot 100 Across Four (or More) Decades Michael Jackson Biopic Trailer Breaks Record With 116 Million Views Jackson surpasses Andy Williams, who died in 2012 and whose history includes placements in the top 10 in five decades (‘50s, ’60s, ’70s, ‘10s and ’20s, extended since 2018 thanks to “It’s the Most Wonderful Time of the Year”). Jackson first reached the Hot 100’s top 10 as a soloist in November 1971 with his debut on his own, “Got To Be There.” Jackson boasts 30 top 10s, including 13 No. 1s. Until this week, Jackson, who died in 2009, last ranked in the top 10 as featured on Drake’s “Don’t Matter to Me” in 201…
